roleset.name: reach an agreement
roleset.note: COMPROMISE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'compromise' based on sentence in financial subcorpus. No verbnet entry. Comparison with 'agree' (from compromise.01-v predicate notes)
COMPROMISE-N NOTES: Verb sense compromise.02 not found thus far in noun form. Roleset based on verb entry compromise.01. Corresponds to VN class correspond-36.1. (from compromise.01-n)

example.name: generally unhelpful example
example.text: ``They said universally, without a single exception: *trace* Don't even compromise.

example.name: more illustrative
example.text: John compromised with Mary on the menu for their dinner together.
example.arg: on the menu for their dinner together

example.name: Within LVC
example.text: It feels like maybe she made a compromise.

example.name: All arguments
example.text: A man's wife is his compromise with the illusion of his first sweetheart.
example.arg: with the illusion of his first sweetheart.

example.name: With Arg1
example.text: Senate leaders released more details about their compromise on the home buyer tax credit today.
example.arg: on the home buyer tax credit

roleset.name: lose security, concede, cause to weaken, endanger
roleset.note: COMPROMISE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'compromise' based on sentence in financial subcorpus. No verbnet entry. Comparison with 'agree' (from compromise.02-v predicate notes)
COMPROMISE-N NOTES: Based on sentences in medical data. No VN or FN classes. Framed by Katie. (from compromise.02-n)

example.name: made-up
example.text: [The hygiene of John's home]-1 was compromised *trace*-1 by his habit of leaving his dirty socks lying around.
example.arg: by his habit of leaving his dirty socks lying around.
